intro: Moquilea filomenoi, commonly known as the Filomena moquilea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Moquilea filomenoi is often found in rocky, high-altitude environments where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
